technology.name: Marching to War
technology.description: Ever onwards the Druchii armies march, conflict's breakneck rhythm dictating the pace.

Vigour loss reduction: -5%
	(own armies factionwide in enemy territory)
Speed: +10% for Dreadspears, Darkshards, Bleakswords and Black Ark Corsairs units
"Bloody Sacrifice" sacrifice even more slaves

technology.name: Bolt Cartridges
technology.description: You'll like this, it's got a fast-action reload; you can kill the Asur all day long without pausing for more than a second.

technology.name: Black Iron Armour
technology.description: The hardest of substances, when heated to the optimum temperature, may be drawn into mail, plate or scale.

technology.name: Bloodforged Platemail
technology.description: Black steel, mixed with sacrificial blood and etched with powerful runes, makes the best armour produced in Naggarond.

technology.name: Driven by Vengeance
technology.description: The deep-seated, profoundly-ingrained desire for revenge consumes and drives one forward.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units
Melee attack: +4 for Dreadspears, Bleakswords, Black Ark Corsairs and Darkshards units

technology.name: Martial Society
technology.description: Every aspect of the Druchii world is directed to warfare, as it should be when war is a permanent state of affairs.

effects.description: Battle reinforcement time: -25%
Recruit rank: +2 for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units

technology.name: Forged to Kill
technology.description: Steel is only as strong as the hand that wields it.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Dreadspears, Darkshards, Bleakswords and Black Ark Corsairs units
Missile strength: +10% for Darkshards and Black Ark Corsairs units

technology.name: Hit & Run
technology.description: To strike like lightning and then melt away - that is the way of the irregular warrior.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units
Weapon strength: +10% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Shades and Dark Riders units

technology.name: An Instrument of War
technology.description: Muscle, flesh, and the skeleton that binds them can be finely tuned for maximum violence.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%
Recruit rank: +2 for Black Guard of Naggarond units
Recruit rank: +2 for Har Ganeth Executioners units

technology.name: Exotic Beast Hide Armour
technology.description: Some creatures have a natural outer carapace, so hard that it may double as armour once removed from its original owner.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Black Ark Corsairs, Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units

technology.name: No Signs of Weakness
technology.description: Used to slaying their own kin at the first sign of fragility or compassion, Naggarothi armies constantly prune their own ranks.

Leadership: +4 for Dreadspears, Bleakswords, Darkshards, Black Ark Corsairs and Dark Riders units

technology.name: Ceremonial Weapons
technology.description: The ornate, ceremonial weapons used in Khainite rituals give power to subsequent acts of murder carried out in his bloody name.

technology.description: Some choices require next to no thought whatsoever.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present

technology.name: Battle as Business
technology.description: For the Dark Elves, war is transactional - for Druchii blood to be spilled there must be payment, in the form of loot, preferably.

Income from raiding: +15%

technology.name: Naval Training
technology.description: You start with not drowning; once that has been achieved, the rest will swiftly follow - unless a watery grave appeals of course.

technology.description: Research the following items to take the Dark Elves' vicious military machine to another level of cruelty altogether.

technology.description: To the victor go the spoils - be they coin or place or the lives of the defeated.

technology.description: Where better to become proficient in the arts of war? Where the very soil is stained with the blood of failure!

technology.description: There is no tolerance for failure in Naggarond, no matter how trivial the error.

technology.name: Founded on Tyranny
technology.description: Start as you mean to go on and your population will never know what they may be missing.

effects.description: Growth: +10

technology.name: Continuous Slave Supply
technology.description: There's always more work to be done and, fortunately, a constant stream of unfortunate wretches whose only option is to do it.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +10%
Income from Ports: +10%

technology.name: Tempered in Blood
technology.description: It is often necessary to execute a few - publicly of course - to quench the fires of revolt in all the others.

effects.description: Income from raiding: +50%
Income from slaves: +3%

technology.name: Purge the Weak
technology.description: There is no place in the Druchii's empire of cruelty for those of a mild disposition.

effects.description: Income from Settlement buildings: +10%
Income from faction capital settlement: +10%

technology.name: Consumed by Rivalry
technology.description: When hatred consumes the soul, what other reason can there be to carry on living?

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Loyalty: +2 for new recruits
Control: +1

technology.name: Divide & Conquer
technology.description: This aeons-old maxim never stops being true, and a most effective stratagem.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Dark Elves
Diplomatic relations: +25 with High Elves
Character experience gain per turn: +50

technology.name: A Life of Dread
technology.description: Everyone, be they of high or low birth, have good cause to be fearful of who is watching and what they might tell the authorities.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +10%
Income from slaves: +3%
Melee attack: +4 during ambushes

technology.name: Endless Debauchery
technology.description: Every depraved, degenerate, impure licentiousness; everything to excess, for that is the Dark Prince's wish.

technology.name: Festivals of Ruin
technology.description: A gathering of those perversely in thrall to the Dark Prince, in the hope that his fickle eye be turned - and, thusly, his favour secured.
